byline.contributor: Falih Hassan reported from Baghdad, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo. Omar Al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad, and Sewell Chan from London.
byline.original: By FALIH HASSAN and KAREEM FAHIM

abstract: Iraqi reinforcements are sent into Ramadi, in push to retake city's central government outpost from Islamic State; losing hold on city would be biggest in recent series of setbacks for militant group, and first key victory for Iraqi Army without formal assistance of Kurds or Shiite militias.
lead_paragraph: Soldiers pushed toward a government complex and battled to regain control of a southern district in the second day of an offensive to retake the city.

headline.main: Iraq Sends More Troops to Fight ISIS in Ramadi
headline.print_headline: Iraq Adds Troops in Effort to Recapture Ramadi From Islamic State

snippet: Soldiers pushed toward a government complex and battled to regain control of a southern district in the second day of an offensive to retake the city.
